title: Build a Render Function
description:
Now create a `render` function that converts your element objects into real DOM elements and adds them to the page. **What you need to do:** - Create a function called `render` - It should accept: `element` (object from createElement) and `container` (DOM element) - Create a DOM element using `document.createElement(element.type)` - Set all props as attributes on the DOM element - Handle children: if a child is a string, create a text node; if it's an object, recursively call render - Append the created element to the container **Example usage:** ```javascript const element = createElement('div', { id: 'test' }, 'Hello'); const container = document.getElementById('app'); render(element, container); // Creates:
Hello
inside the container ``` **Tips:** - Use `document.createElement()` to create DOM elements - Use `setAttribute()` to set attributes - Use `document.createTextNode()` for text content - Use `appendChild()` to add elements to the DOM - Remember to recursively call `render()` for nested element objects!
